alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Lee; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Breathitt, northeastern Lee and southeastern Wolfe Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilhurst, or near Jackson, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shockey around 910 PM EDT. Sewell, Fivemile, Frozen Creek, Moct, Gentry, Yeadon and Chenowee around 915 PM EDT. Keck, Taulbee, Elkatawa and Rock Lick around 920 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mountain Valley, Jackson, Noctor, Inverness, Bays, Quicksand, Dumont, Curt, Haginsville, Portsmouth, Smith Branch, Stevenson, Rousseau, Guage and Camp Lewis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
